p: [u' ', u'They say bachelors live wild, rocking lives and have a busy social calendar. Is it true?', u' If you think that single men in the 21st century India have a great time keeping their social calendar happening, then think again! Like single women who have to undergo societal pressures of getting married and facing a tough independent life, many single men agree that having a busy social calendar and meeting women is equally a challenging situation.', u' The lighter side of being a bachelor is you don\'t have to be of a "certain type" to be a part of a social brigade. You don\'t have to be rich, educated, intelligent - you just have to be yourself. Anish Gajjar, a businessman says, "Girls are equally interested to just be friends and move with the flow." Manbir Singh Dua a caterer says, "Unlike other cities, where you walk into a pub, meet a person, and forget about them, in smaller cities in India, people take you seriously and friendships form for a long period of time. I like this slower process."', u'  ', u'Refrain from posting comments that are obscene, defamatory or inflammatory, and do not indulge in personal attacks, name calling or inciting hatred against any community. p:
[u'
	', u'Men often reach a point in their lives when they must make that important decision – “do I get married?', u'
	Or do I finish the last beer in the fridge?” And believe me these are not easy decisions to make. Of course the beer almost ', u'always wins', u', because once you are married, there is no such thing as a last beer in the fridge. You will make sure you have a steady and continuous flow of alcohol.', u'
	Which brings us to the topic of discussion; Marriage vs. Bachelorhood, which is really better? The bachelors will obviously say their way of life rocks, and married men, well, will agree. This is because men do not get married for the same reason women do. A woman gets married because she wants to settle down, raise a family and build a home. A man gets married because that’s the only way to get a woman to sleep with him without taking her out on an expensive date. BIG difference.', u'
	Bachelors, on the other hand, have it pretty good. You wouldn’t really associate the word ‘responsibility’ to a man that isn’t married. But then again, these men have their own cup of woes to deal with. Having to decide where to party on a Saturday night, waking up next to women, sometimes even men they don’t know and then forgetting to call these women and men back. This is not the kind of life for the everyday guy. So if you look at it, so far, both married and bachelor life pretty much suck.', u'
	But let’s look at this from a different point of view. How much does marriage really ', u'change the lifestyle', u' of a bachelor? Now you have a gorgeous woman who you love living with you. If your luck is good and she’s a great cook, then add fresh, homemade food to the list. And in the long run, the two of you will be able to celebrate the miracle of birth when you have kids. Is this really that bad? Well not until her mother shows up, but we’ll leave that for another day. The real issue that most married men have with being married is not marriage itself; rather it’s all the fun things that they have to give up, just because there is a woman in the house. Let’s face it video games are cool, no matter how old you are. And what is wrong if a man wants to completely ignore the existence of his wife during a football match? The odd fart once in a while in the corner of the living room is just him marking his territory. Let him be.', u'
	The real deal here is to know when your time as a bachelor is up and when you should look at finding a bride. In all honesty, it takes a certain amount of panache to pull off the bachelor way of life well into your forties. Besides George Clooney and Johnny Depp, very few men make it look cool. Unless you want to be frowned upon by everyone in your family as well as the neighbour’s cat, pick an age by which you think you’ll be done with all the things that married life does not permit, because that’s the only reason why men prefer to remain single isn’t it?', u'
	A smart man is one who strikes a balance between bachelorhood and ', u'marriage', u', but it takes a genius to live like a bachelor even after you tie the knot, but again, more on that in another article. The way I would go about it, is to make a plan of sorts, put together a list of things I want to do by myself, like travel, adventure sports and Sudoku puzzles. Once I have exhausted the list, I’ll find a young girl to make my wife. No matter how much you swear by being single and all the greatness it offers, you gotta accept the fact that farts don’t smell that good when you are 65 and living on your own.', u'
	Learn to get the best out of both phases of your adult life. There is no real winner in this argument. Bachelors end up wanting what married men have (their wives), married men want what bachelors have (a fridge full of beer, even trade?). So it’s a vicious cycle eventually. Every man must compulsorily face the challenge and ecstasy of being a bachelor and then by choice rue the decision of getting married. Such is the way of life. Now to gulp down that last beer, cheers!', u'
	', u'You may also like:', u'
	', u'Why is the Indian Male Obsessed With Fair Skin?', u'
	', u'Do Men Really Want Their Wives to be Like Their Mothers?', u'\xa0']

title: title

p: [u'\n                ', u'Each man and woman of this world has two stages in their life before marriage and after marriage. We shall discuss about the troubles and pleasures they are facing in these two stages here.', u'\n            ', u'Married life', u'In married life we get more relationships. Love and care of Husband/Wife, In-laws and children are greatest feeling we cannot get in bachelor life. Being a parent is a great blessing and caring our parents and In-laws by giving them rest is greatest blessing. Can find pleasure and boon in serving our family with whole heart. Also we have full freedom and license to spend days with our beloveds in married life only. In bachelor life we are dependent on parents but here we are independent to make decisions and fulfill our wishes. The responsibility comes after marriage makes us realize what is life? and what we are living for? ', u"But in married life we are in lots of pressure to lead the family. The status of the one who hasn't get the right life partner is pitiable. His/her life will be a struggle with the daily fights for silly matters, ego problems, suspect ions, unexpected words from our loved one etc.,", u'Married women', u"They have to care In-laws, children and relations in the married life. They have to be bounded to house maintaining pressure in the daily life from sending the children school till making all the family members to sleep by caring them and their health, worries they have in the outside world etc., They have responsibility of guiding and bringing up children in a right way. They have to guide in their Home works. They need to cook for their family. After all they should first know how to treat and mingle with the people(relatives) in In-laws house. They should be trained and to be adjustable with all the members of their husband's family. If leading life individually then managing house is more difficult than joint family. Because they won't have the family members who were the ladies of their husband's family. They should change their mind set to live without the assistance of their parents who were with them till the marriage.", u'Married men', u'He will be little free from financial pressures as he has his life partner to discuss about the financial matters before spending it. Being Financial head he should be responsible for earning, loan, Insurances, shares, etc etc. Not only financial pressure they are also out of pressure to satisfy and give pleasure to family members as it would be a responsibility of Family head. Bachelor life is free from all these. All the big decisions have to be taken by them without depending anyone than the life partner. The responsibilities will sometime tight them in a fixed job for lot of years by barring the bad events happening at the office or work places. He has to be the role model for his children. So he has to get away from the world that he was living before his marriage with his friends before marriage. ', u'Bachelor life', u'In Bachelor life we can enjoy by being out of pressures. We are not bound to responsibilities mentioned in married life. Here we can be very relaxed from managing and making life. All advices guidelines and supports are given by parents. We have to just follow them to get it out done. we will be given full care. All responsibilities are taken over by our parents. Earning at bachelor life is just like a pass time. Here we can just earn and give to parents. All managing works are done by parents and spending with our own money will be nice.', u"If we think about the worries we have in the bachelor life, the most part of the answer will be occupied by the words love and friendship that will dis appear from our life in the practical future days before the surviving needs. In the bachelor life we have no need to think about taking and changing the decisions like joining or leaving a job. Because we can be in home for few days till getting the better job with the support of our parents. But after marriage we can't do so, because if we didn't earn a month, then the next month food of the members of the family under us will get question mark. ", u'We can go anywhere without worrying about anything. For an example, in the bachelor life we can go any tourist place with our friends or alone and go where ever we want and enjoy. But after marriage where ever we go, we have to go with family else we will be questioned. Going with the family we have to be thinking about them ever at the tourist place we have gone. Even Though we are enjoying, we have to be thinking about them that when they will feel hungry, what will make them sick, to which places and all we can get them, what are the secured tourist places, what are the healthy foods to have etc.,', u'I am 29 years of age as of date and enjoying my life as a bachelor and intend to continue to live like this till I die. Yes some of your statements regarding marriage are quite enticing for bachelors to get started on considering marriage as a future life choice but when these are scrutinized in detail the restrictions and risks that marriage carries are simply too much for a man to handle. Personally I rather live like a Tiger Solitary and Powerful and free for life than like a Lion who has to live in a pack and carry the burden of his pack for life.', u'On reading this article I remember a comparison my college lecturer,who was just married, told us when we asked about how he felt as married man.', u'His remark was that marriage was a destination all bachelors are in a hurry to reach at, and the already married want to return but not able to do so, being trapped for life. He also added that it just proved the old saying "the grass is always green on the others side".', u'Personally I feel one should  experience  the unmarried stages for its due time and then move on to experience the bliss( and bane) of marriage. It is like the labour pain-it gives pain and pleasure. To forget the pain and to relish the pleasure is in our hands.']

We have to just follow them to get it out done. we will be given full care. All responsibilities are taken over by our parents. Earning at bachelor life is just like a pass time. Here we can just earn and give to parents. All managing works are done by parents and spending with our own money will be nice.', u"If we think about the worries we have in the bachelor life, the most part of the answer will be occupied by the words love and friendship that will dis appear from our life in the practical future days before the surviving needs. In the bachelor life we have no need to think about taking and changing the decisions like joining or leaving a job. Because we can be in home for few days till getting the better job with the support of our parents. But after marriage we can't do so, because if we didn't earn a month, then the next month food of the members of the family under us will get question mark. ", u'We can go anywhere without worrying about anything. For an example, in the bachelor life we can go any tourist place with our friends or alone and go where ever we want and enjoy. But after marriage where ever we go, we have to go with family else we will be questioned. Going with the family we have to be thinking about them ever at the tourist place we have gone. Even Though we are enjoying, we have to be thinking about them that when they will feel hungry, what will make them sick, to which places and all we can get them, what are the secured tourist places, what are the healthy foods to have etc.,', u'Guest Author: Tiger Woods', u'18 Oct 2013', u'Author: ', u'Venkiteswaran.', u'05 Jul 2014']
title: [u'\n\tMarried Life vs Bachelor Life\n']

p:
[u'Famous bachelors', u' from across the world have always inspired their buffs to stay single. And indeed, sometime it feels that folks who write about\xa0fairytales of marital life don’t have any\xa0goddam clue about the actual mechanism of married life. With the spirit of helping out, TopYaps is listing ten most famous bachelors of the world who decided to skip the “I do” step.', u'\xa0', u'Even if you avoid the camera and photography thing; you’ve to go for it one day when your wife will snap some ‘angle best’ photos as a keepsake of your memorable honeymoon. But here’s a point to be noted that the man who is behind “locking” some of the best moments of your married life, never walked down the aisle throughout his life.\xa0Founder of the Eastman Kodak Company and the\xa0discoverer of roll film, George Eastman has had a great romance and a sensuous affair, but only with his camera. ', u' (', u'img source: ', u'heatherbuckley.co.uk', u')', u'James Buchanan was the 15th President of the United States, who lived and died a bachelor. During the days of struggle, Buchanan was engaged to Ann Caroline Coleman, daughter of a wealthy businessman; but due to some unexplained reasons their engagement was called off. This incident was a terrible blow for the him, and it escalated to the uttermost\xa0altitude when Ann died soon after the\xa0separation. ', u' (', u'img source: ', u'imagenoise.com', u')', u'Best known as the “Missile Man of India”, Dr. Kalam is an eminent nuclear scientist as well as a notable aerospace engineer who also served as the 11th President of India from July 25, 2002 to July 25, 2007. Widely admired for his\xa0foresightedness and shatterproof determination, Dr. Kalam’s affection for space science and the glowing fire on his wings of aspirations\xa0overstepped the desire of walking on the marital landscape. ', u' (', u'img source: ', u'abdulkalam.com', u')', u'“The Godfather” knows the “Scent of a Woman”, but he prefers the single status. However on “Any Given Sunday”, he has courted some of the knockout beauties of movie industry, but till the date, he is the longest serving bachelor of Hollywood. Our beloved Michael Corleone is screaming towards his mid seventies (currently sitting on the cliff of 72), but he still hopes to tie the knot. Tony, we’re waiting for the day when you’ll finally introduce us with our Godmother but will feel sorry to see you going out from this list. ', u' (', u'img source: ', u'25.media.tumblr.com', u')', u'Sir Edward Richard George “Ted” Heath was a notable politician of the Conservative Party and also served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1970-1974. A buff of music in classic sense, Sir Heath was also known for having number of female friends. He had been expected to marry one of his childhood friends Kay Raven, but he preferred to not go to the Church to say “I do” in front of a holy man and remained a lifelong bachelor.', u'(', u'img source: ', u'article.wn.com', u')', u'The man, who revolutionized the entire world by his staggering discoveries and in-depth researches, is also known for being one of the most famous bachelors throughout the existence of human race. He stayed single during his life span of 83 years and amazingly repelled the love-bug from his very own dimension.', u'(', u'img source: ', u'guardian.co.uk', u')', u'In the list of famous bachelors of the world, Voltaire ranks fourth. Apart from being the great grandfather of satire, he is also highly regarded for his advocacy of freedom of expression and civil liberties. Voltaire’s life was full of series of intellectual mistresses but instead of tying the knot for at least once, he favoured and maintained the “being single” status forever.', u'(', u'img source: ', u'constitution.org', u')', u'The no. 3 famous bachelor of this list is a radical inventor without whom we can’t imagine the wholeness of mathematics and physics. Blaise Pascal was a computing genius who gave innumerable significant explanations in the field of science. During his short life span of 39 years, he opened the gateways of complex theories but kept closed the doors for the marriage thing.', u'(', u'img source: ', u'abolitionist.com', u')', u'For music lovers, there will never be words to show affection and respect for Beethoven and his historic masterpieces. This German composer is a crucial figure in music world who contributed a lot for the Western art music. He marked his presence on the planet earth for 57 year with romantic attachment with number of interesting women. However, his companionships with ladies never blossomed and decided to remain single throughout his life.', u'Leonardo da Vinci—the most famous bachelor of the world, was a godsend soul with quenchless curiosity for almost everything in this world. Best known for being the most gifted person ever to have lived, Da Vinci’s private life was extremely secret and which has been a potent subject of analysis for historians. He died at the age of 67, finding happiness in a never-married life.', u'(', u'img source: ', u'artmarketingsecrets.com', u')', u'
Another hurdle for the movie. ', u"
Let's see what Varun decide. ", u'
Mira will be really angry! ', u'
Just look around you. ', u'

span: [u'Save your draft', u' before refreshing this page.', u'Submit any pending changes before refreshing this page.', u'Quora', u' ', u'Indian Marriage', u' ', u'Indian Women', u' ', u'Laws in India', u' ', u'Question That Contains Assumptions', u' ', u'Indian Ethnicity and People', u' ', u'India', u'As a young Indian bachelor, should I avoid marriage due to all the anti-male marital laws prevalent in India?', u'a few examples of such laws - dowry act, domestic violence act, divorce laws, child custody laws ', u'Edit:', u' adultery laws, IPC 498a, 304B.', u"I feel that after marriage, I'll be automatically reduced to a second class citizen, with no legal rights, at the mercy of my wife.", u'Edit1: Some links-', u'1) Honorable Supreme Court calls Dowry Act as a potential "legal terrorism"', u": National : Dowry law is a shield, not an assassin's weapon: court", u' ', u'2) ', u'Adultery law biased against men, says Supreme Court', u'3) ', u'Government bid to give wives inherited property share - The Times of India', u'4) ', u'Just Married: Have You Applied for Bail - ', u' A highly rated book on the anti-male marital laws in India', u'5) ', u'498A: The Wedding Gift', u" - A movie made on women's misuse of IPC 498a", u'Edit2: Links from Quora itself-', u'1) ', u"Anonymous' answer to What are some cases/stories where women have misused Indian laws, which were actually made to protect them?", u' ', u'2) ', u"Anonymous' answer to Why is it difficult to date an Indian woman in general?", u'p.s. : Also read my own answer to this question :-) I had to do it.', u' ', u'Aakanksha Joshi', u', ', u'L.L.B. from Mumbai University, Solicitor from the Bombay Incorporated Law Society', u'4.2k', u' \u2022 ', u'Laws in India', u'To have any kind of reasonable understanding of the aims and effects of any law, it would be necessary to examine the provisions that are being impugned (challenged).', u'\xa0', u'The anti-dowry law, I believe is causing a great deal of concern. Let us look at Section 304B of the Indian Penal Code.', u'\xa0', u'304B. Dowry death.\u2014(1) Where the death of a woman is caused by any ', u'burns or bodily injury or occurs otherwise than under normal circumstances', u' within seven years of her marriage and ', u'it is shown', u' that soon before her death ', u'she was subjected to cruelty or har\xadassment by her husband or any relative of her husband for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry', u', such death shall be called \u201cdowry death\u201d, and such husband or relative shall be deemed to have caused her death.', u' ', u'The Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 makes it an offence to demand and receive dowry punishable with fine and imprisonment for not less than five years.', u'\xa0', u'Domestic violence laws are another concern.', u'\xa0', u'The Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005 defines what domestic violence it and makes it punishable. Domestic violence is defined in Section 3 as:', u'\xa0', u'any act, omission or commission or conduct of the respondent shall constitute domestic violence in case it \u2013 ', u'\xa0', u'(a)\xa0\xa0 ', u'harms or injures or endangers the health, safety, life, limb or well-being', u', whether mental or physical, of the aggrieved person or tends to do so and includes causing physical abuse, sexual abuse, verbal and emotional abuse and economic abuse; or ', u'\xa0', u'(b)\xa0 harasses, harms, injures or endangers the aggrieved person with a view to coerce her or any other person related to her to meet any unlawful demand for any dowry or other property or valuable security; or ', u'\xa0', u'(c)\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 has the effect of threatening the aggrieved person or any person related to her by any conduct mentioned in clause (a) or clause (b); ', u'\xa0', u'(d)\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 otherwise injures or causes harm, whether physical or mental, to the aggrieved person. ', u'\xa0', u'\xa0', u'Explanation I', u'For the purposes of this section,- ', u'(i) "physical abuse" means any act or conduct which is of such a nature as to cause\xa0 bodily pain, harm, or danger to life, limb, or health or impair the health or development of the\xa0 aggrieved person and includes assault, criminal intimidation and criminal force; ', u'(ii) "sexual abuse" includes any conduct of a sexual nature that abuses, humiliates, degrades or otherwise violates the dignity of woman; ', u'(iii) "verbal and emotional abuse" includes- ', u'(a) insults, ridicule, humiliation, name calling and insults or ridicule specially with regard to not having a child or a male child; ', u'and ', u'(b) repeated threats to cause physical pain to any\xa0 person in whom the\xa0 aggrieved person is interested.', u'(iv) "economic abuse" includes- ', u'(a) deprivation of all or any economic or financial resources to which the aggrieved person is entitled under any law or custom whether payable under an order of a court or otherwise or which the aggrieved person requires out of\xa0 necessity including, but not limited to, household necessities for the aggrieved person and her children, if any, stridhan, property , jointly or separately owned\xa0 by the aggrieved person, payment of rental related to the shared household and maintenance; ', u'\xa0', u'(b) disposal of household effects, any alienation of assets whether movable or immovable, valuables, shares, securities, bonds and the like or other property\xa0 in which the aggrieved person has an interest or is entitled to use by virtue of\xa0 the domestic relationship or which may be reasonabl y required by the\xa0 aggrieved person or her children or her stridhan or any other property jointly ', u'or separately held by the aggrieved person; and\xa0 ', u'\xa0', u'(c) prohibition or restriction to continued access\xa0 to resources or facilities\xa0 which the aggrieved person is entitled to use or en joy by virtue of the domestic relationship including access to the shared household', u'\xa0', u'\xa0', u'Explanation II. -For the purpose of determining whether any act, omission, commission or conduct of the respondent constitutes "domestic violence" under this section, ', u'the overall facts and circumstances of the case shall be taken into consideration.', u' ', u'The Domestic Violence Act provides for shelters for victims of domestic violence, providing medical and legal aid to victims as well as counselling. Under this provision, only a married man can prosecute another man who has an affair with his wife. That is because the women was considered his property and the other man trespassed it. ', u'\xa0', u'Remember that a married woman cannot prosecute the adulteress (the woman with whom her husband has sex). Because technically\xa0 he is not her property. ', u'\xa0', u"So, practically what happens is if a woman's husband has an affair, that woman has no remedy. Whereas, if a man's wife has an affair the man can prosecute the man. ", u'\xa0', u'Remember under this provision the no woman can prosecute a man. But only a married man can prosecute another man. Technically even if only a man is punished, the right to prosecute is also given to a man alone. li: [u'Is it that due to Indian police, people avoid to help people in need?', u'Will India have a single marriage law in the coming years?', u'Considering the current anti-male atmosphere and prevalence of legal terrorism in India, should Indian men get married? If they do, what preca...', u'Does it make sense for a bachelor Indian male to get married when the institution of marriage is falling apart due to laws like DV, DP Act and...', u'How do Indian males endure a failed marriage?', u'Try to get the divorce on mutual consent.', u'If you press me hard, I will file a divorce from your side but the chances are next to nil that you will get a divorce unless your wife is willing.', u'Be prepared for at least 3 cases on you. IPC 498a, Domestic Violence, Maintenance. (Our govt has granted a bouquet of 3 cases for women.)', u'If your wife is having a salary lower than you or is not working then be prepared to shell out a good amount as an interim maintenance (till the time maintenance case is solved courts grant interim maintenance to ladies).', u'498a is a criminal non-bailable section and if it is filed on you there is 99.9% chance you will be incarcerated for 1-14 days in jail. Your family members may or may-not go to jail but for sure they will be harassed like hell by the Police.', u'Try to get the divorce on mutual consent.', u'No problem, just let me know the amount you will want to get as a one time settlement. I can get it increased if instead of giving a fixed sum as fee, you give me a percentage of whatever amount you get as compensation. ', u'Do you also want to send him to jail? How about his family members?', u"That's all what I wish - gender neutral marital laws. I'm pissed off with this whole 'abala nari' thing where only the woman can be the victim and only man can be the perpetrator.", u'1 more problem that needs to be corrected is this: In some laws, the man is assumed guilty unless proven innocent. I guess nowhere in the world is this the case. It violates the basic tenet of justice.', u'Also, provisions of the laws are ambiguous and open to interpretation, which can really catch up on to the man.', u'ALL LAWS ARE CAPABLE OF BEING MISUSED -Thats unavoidable, and OK if the laws can be equally misused by women and men. Some of the laws which I mentioned can only be misused by women - Is that fair?', u'Plus, there are no strict provisions against misuse of such laws.', u"a new bill talks about only the division of husband's properties, but not wife\u2019s properties. So in case woman is at fault, still she will get 50% share in husband's property, but her share of property will not be divided.", u'a wife can oppose a husband\u2019s plea for divorce under the new ground (irretrievable breakdown) stating that the divorce would cause grave financial hardship. The husband however, cannot oppose a wife\u2019s plea for divorce under this ground.', u'The amendment will give a woman right to 50% of the residential property owned by her husband even if it is acquired before the marriage. p: [u'(Any opinions expressed here are those of the author and not necessarily of Reuters)', u'A man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh.', u'This verse on marriage from the Book of Genesis in the Bible is meant for men in general.', u'For Indians, it becomes especially pressing when they reach a certain \u2018marriageable\u2019 age, with concerned parents, relatives and friends urging them to settle down.', u'Still, some decide to take the road less travelled. ', u'Rahul Gandhi', u', the 42-year-old scion of the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty and perhaps India\u2019s most famous bachelor, hinted this week he may shun marital life to stay away from dynasty politics.', u'\u201cIf I get married and have children, I will be status-quoist and will like my children to take my place,\u201d he ', u'told Congress party lawmakers', u'.', u'Here\u2019s a look at reasons other celebrity bachelors have given for staying single:', u'Fear of the unknown', u': Industrialist ', u'Ratan Tata', u' ', u'told', u' CNN International\u2019s Talk Asia that he came \u201cseriously close\u201d to getting married four times but cited \u201cfear\u201d among the reasons why he never took the plunge. The 75-year-old former chairman of Tata Group said he did not regret not getting married.', u'Mirror, mirror on the wall: ', u'Actor ', u'Rahul Bose', u', known for the unconventional parts he chooses in arthouse cinema, uses self-deprecating humour.', u'\u201c\u2026 I\u2019m so ugly, there are no chicks,\u201d the 45-year-old actor ', u'said', u', adding he will have to become \u201cvery rich\u201d to be able to find a bride.', u'Having kids without marriage: ', u'Bollywood actor\xa0', u'Salman Khan', u' seems to like the idea. In a country where parents usually want their children to get married before turning 30, the popular 47-year-old actor has often faced the \u2018M\u2019 question. \u201cI am working on a way I can escape marriage and just have the kids,\u201d Khan ', u'told fans', u' recently.', u'Too busy: ', u'Former', u' ', u'Prime Minister', u' ', u'Atal Bihari Vajpayee', u', now 88, was once asked why he never settled down. He reportedly ', u'said,', u' \u201cI didn\u2019t find time.\u201d', u'Work over family:', u' He\u2019s a scientist and was one of India\u2019s most popular presidents, but can a huge part of ', u'APJ Abdul Kalam', u'\u2018s achievements be attributed to his single status?', u'A book about the man described as \u2018the father of India\u2019s missile programme\u2019 says that Kalam once told a friend jocularly ', u'that if he had married', u', he would never have achieved even half of what he has managed.', u'You can follow the author on twitter ', u'@confusedat30', u'\n    ', u'\n    ', u'We welcome comments that advance the story through relevant opinion, anecdotes, links and data. If you see a comment that you believe is irrelevant or inappropriate, you can flag it to our editors by using the report abuse links. Views expressed in the comments do not represent those of Reuters. For more information on our comment policy, see ', u'http://blogs.reuters.com/fulldisclosure/2010/09/27/toward-a-more-thoughtful-conversation-on-stories/', u'Why can\u2019t lost love be a factor?? I can find more than one of the above celebrity fall in this category,though they wont accept. Though my story is not a news material,i am still a bachelor because i still can\u2019t get over my first love..even after 10 years', u'Oh come on now. Rahul Gandhi is having an affair with an Italian girl although her name\u2019s not disclosed and he won\u2019t accept it, reports are that he\u2019s not marrying because of the pressure asserted on him by national congress.', u'News and Media Division of ', u'Thomson Reuters', u"Thomson Reuters is the world's largest international multimedia news agency, providing investing news, world news, business news, technology news, headline news, small business news, news alerts, personal finance, stock market, and mutual funds information available on Reuters.com, video, mobile, and interactive television platforms. Thomson Reuters journalists are subject to an ", u'Editorial Handbook', u' which requires fair presentation and disclosure of relevant interests.', u'NYSE and AMEX quotes delayed by at least 20 minutes. Nasdaq delayed by at least 15 minutes. For a complete list of exchanges and delays, please ', u'click here', u'.']

					', u"Hey. I Don't know if it is the right forum to post as a guy  but i just wanted to share something. ", u'
Indian society is so different than others. People here expect you to go along with what they consider the ', u'"Natural order of things".', u' Like getting married and having kids. ', u'
', u"Lets be clear. I have no desire to ever get married or have kids. I decided it way back when i was 10 years old and haven't changed my mind since and probably never will.", u'
So, just yesterday, my mom brought the subject about marriage and it grew into an argument.', u"
I don't want much from life. I just want a good job and some money so that i could help poor people as much as i could. That is what i always wanted. I don't think having a family would make ", u'happy', u' at all. ', u'
Plus.', u' I have a family which is so close to me so why would i need to make my own ? ', u'
 What possibly could a wife and a kid bring ? ', u'
', u'I have seen married men and they look so stressed and have so many responsibilities. ', u'
Sorry, ladies. My post went too long and i apologize if i offended anyone with my post. ', u'
My genuine question is. ', u"
What's so good about having a wife  and kids ? ", u'
', u'And Is it possible  for a guy to be bachelor forever ? ', u'
					', u'\xa0', u'

				', u'
					
					It is possible. There are tons of confirmed bachelors even in India. ', u'
', u"
It it is neither fair on you or the girl if either of you isn't interested in getting married. Bit perverse as it may sound, to the previous generation one big incentive for marriage is the physical intimacy bit. I guess your fathers amusement stems from his assumption that somewhere down the line you are going to want it too. ", u'
', u"
Marriage is a very personal thing. The views on it vary from person to person. I wanted companionship. Someone I could come home to and have a chat with about my day. It wasn't until I was married for about 8 years that I even remotely felt I wanted a child. ", u'
', u"
Perhaps your views will change. Perhaps you will meet a lovely person whom you want to share your life with. Perhaps none of that will happen and you'd want to be by yourself. Only you can decide when the time comes.

	', u'
', u"Well. Firstly I am not a huge Fan of what people call Love. I don't even believe in it and secondly i have always preferred to live alone. Even when i was in School, i loved my personal space. And thirdly. I don't understand women at all.:bonk", u'
', u'
', u'
', u'Are you the only son/child for parents?', u'
', u'Nope. I have a brother. ', u'
', u'
', u'
', u'Does your mom have excessive fascination for babies? Could that be the reason?', u'
', u'
', u"Well. I don't know about that. It was just a random conversation which start from nowhere and got little deep. ", u'I know, my age is not even enough to fit in what Indian government has set for a guy to marry. But i am mature enough to know how my future would be like and what i would like to do i guess. ', u'
', u'
', u'But there is a deep rooted mentality in India for marriage and kids and it kind of sucks you know. ', u'
